thread.title: Trump: Perez's selection as new DNC leader is good — for GOP
thread.title_full: Trump: Perez's selection as new DNC leader is good — for GOP | Washington Examiner

author: Kyle Feldscher
title: Trump: Perez's selection as new DNC leader is good — for GOP
text:
President Trump congratulated former Labor Secretary Tom Perez on becoming the new leader of the Democratic National Committee, saying his selection will be good — for Republicans.
"Congratulations to Thomas Perez, who has just been named Chairman of the DNC. I could not be happier for him, or for the Republican Party!" Trump tweeted.
Congratulations to Thomas Perez, who has just been named Chairman of the DNC. I could not be happier for him, or for the Republican Party!— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 25, 2017 
Perez defeated Rep. Keith Ellison on the second ballot in Atlanta earlier on Saturday. Ellison was the early front-runner and favorite of the progressive/Bernie Sanders wing of the Democratic Party, while Perez was championed by some of the Obama administration's highest officials, like Vice President Joe Biden.
Stay abreast of the latest developments from nation's capital and beyond with curated News Alerts from the Washington Examiner news desk and delivered to your inbox.
  Washington Examiner News Alerts.   alert soon! Trump didn't weigh in much on the DNC race aside from chiming in to say that Ellison knew he would be the Republican nominee way before anyone else did.
Perez shot back later on Saturday, promising to be Trump's worst nightmare.
Call me Tom. And don't get too happy. @keithellison and I, and Democrats united across the country, will be your worst nightmare. https://t.co/fu7WvLofrD — Tom Perez (@TomPerez) February 25, 2017 
"Call me Tom. And don't get too happy. @keithellison and I, and Democrats united across the country, will be your worst nightmare," he tweeted.
Also from the Washington Examiner For Democrats, a new chairman but still no answers DNC chair Tom Perez must figure out a path back to power for the Democrats.
By David M. Drucker • 02/26/17 12:01 AM
